item.description:
Join me at Pecha Kucha! What's that? Just keep reading all the way to the bottom. If you haven't been yet, this one will be worth checking out! Our very own P-Collective member, Caroline is presenting!!!

Announcing the 45th Pecha Kucha Night in Providence! This month's event will be held at THE MET (Hope Artiste Villiage, 1005 Main Street, Pawtucket). There is a Wednesday evening Farmers Market by FFRI in the Village that evening, and both Mijos and Rocket Fine Street Food Trucks will be outside! Come out and celebrate the LAST PECHAKUCHA NIGHT IN PROVIDENCE OF 2012!!!!!

As always, admission is FREE!!!

The theme this month is....   chaos

The presenters will be announced closer to the event.

If you need additional information or wish to present at a future PechaKucha Night, email us at providencepkn@gmail.com!

We hope to see you on the 19th!!!

If you haven't heard of this global yet unpronounceable phenomenon, Pecha Kucha is a monthly format for sharing ideas, in which presenters are allotted 20 slides and 20 seconds per slide. Put simply: 6 minutes and 40 seconds of adult-style show & tell. It began in Tokyo in 2003, has since spread to over 463 cities worldwide, and first landed in Providence in March of 09.

***Doors open at 7:20, presentations start at 8:20, and schmoozing goes down throughout.***
item.how_to_find_us: This is posted as an FYI (For Your Information) - I will probably be going wearing some kind of scarf. Look for me.
item.name: P-Collective FYI - Pecha Kucha #45 at The Met!!!!
